page.title: 03Seafield Farm
page.content:
The farm is 170 years old,approx 100 acres,all beef cattle.The farmer has lived there since he was born.There are 26 beasts all Charolais and 12 calves are born each year.Breeding cows are kept till 8 years old.They are bought and sold mainly in Stirling or privately to farmers or cattle dealers.Each is worth Â£300-600.They are pure bred but not yet pedigree.
Cattle graze out in summer.In winter they are indoors ,fed twice daily on home grown hay and silage supplemented with barley.Two tractors are kept to work machinery,most of which are for production of silage for winter feeding.One grown animal eats 50 kilos of silage per day.The family work the farm with evening help from two village boys.
